x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: During natural disasters like floods, bush fires, or cyclones, elderly citizens, especially those living alone or without family support, face heightened risks. Local governments often lack real-time visibility into who needs help, where they are, and how to reach them quickly. Manual tracking and reactive responses lead to delays, missed interventions, and preventable harm.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

Flow Designer – automate outreach workflows based on disaster triggers.
IntegrationHub – connect with weather APIs or emergency alert systems.
Service Portal – citizen registration and staff task management.
Custom Tables – store citizen profiles and vulnerability data.
Performance Analytics – visualize outreach metrics and heat maps.
Notification – send SMS or email alerts to citizens and staff.

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

External API Integration: Weather alerts, disaster feeds etc...
Citizen Data Access: Secure integration with government databases or self-registration portals.
Localization & Multilingual Support: For diverse communities.

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

Data Privacy & Consent: Handling personal data requires strict compliance
Data Accuracy: Ensuring citizen profiles are up-to-date and verified
Staff Training: Field agents must be trained on using the platform
Scalability: Handling large volumes of data during widespread disasters
